intro: Corydalis stricta, commonly known as the slender corydalis, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers and lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in woodland or shaded areas, preferring moist, well-drained soil. Its flowers, which range in color from pink to purple, bloom in early spring, adding a subtle touch of color to the landscape. Corydalis stricta is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
